email_content:
Hi Emily,

Great to hear from you! Thanks for asking about life at Sterling & Locke—I love that our pen-pal exchanges always dive into the small cultural details of everyday life.

Here’s a quick snapshot of a fairly typical day for me:
• 9:00 AM – I start by reviewing each client’s investment portfolio and flagging anything that needs immediate attention.
• 10:30 AM – Our team huddles to chat about market news (today it was all about the latest sustainability regulations in the EU—fascinating!).
• 1:00 PM – Lunch in the café downstairs. The barista already knows my order: oat-milk flat white and a veggie wrap.
• 2:00 PM – I disappear into spreadsheets to prep the week’s financial statements. It’s oddly satisfying when the numbers finally reconcile.
• 4:00 PM – Client calls/meetings. Last week I spoke with a new entrepreneur from Kyoto who kept using proverbs to explain cash-flow—so poetic compared to our standard jargon!
• 6:00 PM – A quick look at tomorrow’s calendar, then I’m out the door for an evening run along the river.

Something you might find funny: we once discovered that a formula error in a gigantic spreadsheet stemmed from someone naming a cell “coffee_break.” The entire team now double-checks caffeine-related cell names before EOD. 😄

Outside of work, I’ve been practicing a recipe for matcha-raspberry loaf—if it ever turns out Instagram-worthy, I’ll send you a photo.

How about you? What does a normal Tuesday look like in your part of the world? Any new hobbies or cultural quirks you’ve picked up lately?

Warm regards,
Jane
